verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <S%H5329><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> thou hast searched <S%H2713><s%> me, and known <S%H3045><s%> me.
Thou <S%H859><s%> knowest <S%H3045><s%> my downsitting <S%H3427><s%> and mine uprising, <S%H6965><s%> thou understandest <S%H995><s%> my thought <S%H7454><s%> afar off. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7350><s%>
Thou compassest <S%H2219><s%> my path <S%H734><s%> and my lying down, <S%H7252><s%> and art acquainted <S%H5532><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> my ways. <S%H1870><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> there is not <S%H369><s%> a word <S%H4405><s%> in my tongue, <S%H3956><s%> but, lo, <S%H2005><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> it altogether. <S%H3605><s%>
Thou hast beset <S%H6696><s%> me behind <S%H268><s%> and before, <S%H6924><s%> and laid <S%H7896><s%> thine hand <S%H3709><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me.
Such knowledge <S%H1847><s%> is too wonderful <S%H6383><s%> for <S%H4480><s%> me; it is high, <S%H7682><s%> I cannot <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> attain unto it.
Whither <S%H575><s%> shall I go <S%H1980><s%> from thy spirit? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7307><s%> or whither <S%H575><s%> shall I flee <S%H1272><s%> from thy presence? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I ascend up <S%H5266><s%> into heaven, <S%H8064><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> art there: <S%H8033><s%> if I make my bed <S%H3331><s%> in hell, <S%H7585><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> thou art there.
If I take <S%H5375><s%> the wings <S%H3671><s%> of the morning, <S%H7837><s%> and dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the uttermost parts <S%H319><s%> of the sea; <S%H3220><s%>
Even <S%H1571><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> shall thy hand <S%H3027><s%> lead <S%H5148><s%> me, and thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> shall hold <S%H270><s%> me.
If I say, <S%H559><s%> Surely <S%H389><s%> the darkness <S%H2822><s%> shall cover <S%H7779><s%> me; even the night <S%H3915><s%> shall be light <S%H216><s%> about <S%H1157><s%> me.

Yea, <S%H1571><s%> the darkness <S%H2822><s%> hideth <S%H2821><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thee; but the night <S%H3915><s%> shineth <S%H215><s%> as the day: <S%H3117><s%> the darkness <S%H2825><s%> and the light <S%H219><s%> are both alike to thee.
For <S%H3588><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> hast possessed <S%H7069><s%> my reins: <S%H3629><s%> thou hast covered <S%H5526><s%> me in my mother's <S%H517><s%> womb. <S%H990><s%>

I will praise <S%H3034><s%> thee; for <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3588><s%> I am fearfully <S%H3372><s%> and wonderfully <S%H6395><s%> made: marvelous <S%H6381><s%> are thy works; <S%H4639><s%> and that my soul <S%H5315><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> right well. <S%H3966><s%>

My substance <S%H6108><s%> was not <S%H3808><s%> hid <S%H3582><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thee, when <S%H834><s%> I was made <S%H6213><s%> in secret, <S%H5643><s%> and curiously wrought <S%H7551><s%> in the lowest parts <S%H8482><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> did see <S%H7200><s%> my substance, yet being unperfect; <S%H1564><s%> and in <S%H5921><s%> thy book <S%H5612><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my members were written, <S%H3789><s%> which in continuance <S%H3117><s%> were fashioned, <S%H3335><s%> when as yet there was none <S%H3808><s%> <S%H259><s%> of them.
How <S%H4100><s%> precious <S%H3365><s%> also are thy thoughts <S%H7454><s%> unto me, O God! <S%H410><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> great <S%H6105><s%> is the sum <S%H7218><s%> of them!
If I should count <S%H5608><s%> them, they are more in number <S%H7235><s%> than the sand: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2344><s%> when I awake, <S%H6974><s%> I am still <S%H5750><s%> with thee. <S%H5973><s%>
Surely <S%H518><s%> thou wilt slay <S%H6991><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> O God: <S%H433><s%> depart <S%H5493><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> me therefore, ye bloody <S%H1818><s%> men. <S%H376><s%>
For <S%H834><s%> they speak <S%H559><s%> against thee wickedly, <S%H4209><s%> and thine enemies <S%H6145><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> thy name in vain. <S%H7723><s%>
Do not <S%H3808><s%> I hate <S%H8130><s%> them, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee? and am not I grieved <S%H6962><s%> with those that rise up against <S%H8618><s%> thee?
I hate <S%H8130><s%> them with perfect <S%H8503><s%> hatred: <S%H8135><s%> I count <S%H1961><s%> them mine enemies. <S%H341><s%>
Search <S%H2713><s%> me, O God, <S%H410><s%> and know <S%H3045><s%> my heart: <S%H3824><s%> try <S%H974><s%> me, and know <S%H3045><s%> my thoughts: <S%H8312><s%>
And see <S%H7200><s%> if <S%H518><s%> there be any wicked <S%H6090><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> in me, and lead <S%H5148><s%> me in the way <S%H1870><s%> everlasting. <S%H5769><s%>
